Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

1.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
1.str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

2.str2: Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A mother. Apparently a primary word; a 'mother'.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A sister, a woman (fellow-)member of a church, a Christian woman. Fem of adephos; a sister.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Purity, chastity. From hagnos; cleanliness, i.e. chastity.

This; he, she, it.

9.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

Sixty. The tenth multiple of hex; sixty.
A year. Apparently a primary word; a year.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.

Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

10.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular

First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The stomach. From stoma; an orifice, i.e., the 'stomach'.

23.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
23.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Frequent, often, much. From the same as skenopoios; clasped, i.e. frequent; neuter plural frequently.
From asthenes; feebleness; by implication, malady; morally, frailty.

24.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

24.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Plural
24.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

24.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
24.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Manifest to all, evident, very clear. From pro and delos; plain before all men, i.e. Obvious.

24.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
24.str2: From pro and ago; to lead forward; intransitively, to precede (participle, previous).
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Decision; by extension, a tribunal; by implication, justice.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

24.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural
24.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

24.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
24.str2: To follow close after, accompany, dog; I imitate, pursue, be studious of. From epi and akoloutheo; to accompany.

25.str2: In like manner, likewise, just so. From hos and an adverb from autos; as thus, i.e. In the same way.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
Manifest to all, evident, very clear. From pro and delos; plain before all men, i.e. Obvious.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

25.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Plural
25.str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Otherwise, things that are otherwise. Adverb from allos; differently.

25.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
25.str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
To hide, conceal, lay up. A primary verb; to conceal.
